title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
author: Douglas Adams
description: Seconds before Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy who, for the last fifteen years, has been posing as an out-of-work actor.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
description: The unforgettable novel of a childhood in a sleepy Southern town and the crisis of conscience that rocked it. Compassionate, dramatic, and deeply moving, To Kill A Mockingbird takes readers to the roots of human behavior - to innocence and experience, kindness and cruelty, love and hatred, humor and pathos.

title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
description: The exemplary novel of the Jazz Age, F. Scott Fitzgeralds' third book, The Great Gatsby (1925), stands as the supreme achievement of his career. T. S. Eliot read it three times and saw it as the 'first step' American fiction had taken since Henry James; H. L. Mencken praised 'the charm and beauty of the writing', as well as Fitzgerald's sharp social sense; and Thomas Wolfe hailed it as Fitzgerald's 'best work' thus far. The story of the fabulously wealthy Jay Gatsby and his love for the beautiful Daisy Buchanan, of lavish parties on Long Island at a time when, The New York Times remarked, 'gin was the national drink and sex the national obsession', it is an exquisitely crafted tale of America in the 1920s.

title: The Hobbit
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: The Hobbit, or There and Back Again is a children's fantasy novel by English author J. R. R. Tolkien. It was published on 21 September 1937 to wide critical acclaim, being nominated for the Carnegie Medal and awarded a prize from the New York Herald Tribune for best juvenile fiction. The book remains popular and is recognized as a classic in children's literature.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: The Lord of the Rings is an epic high fantasy novel written by English author and scholar J. R. R. Tolkien. The story began as a sequel to Tolkien's 1937 fantasy novel The Hobbit, but eventually developed into a much larger work. Written in stages between 1937 and 1949, The Lord of the Rings is one of the best-selling novels ever written, with over 150 million copies sold.

title: The Fellowship of the Ring
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: The Fellowship of the Ring is the first part of J. R. R. Tolkien's epic adventure The Lord of the Rings. Set in Middle-earth, the story tells of the Dark Lord Sauron, who is seeking the One Ring. The Ring has found its way to the young hobbit Frodo Baggins, who inherits the Ring and steps into legend. A Fellowship is formed to protect the Ringbearer and make sure that the Ring arrives at its final destination: Mt. Doom, the only place where it can be destroyed.

title: The Two Towers
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: The Two Towers is the second part of J. R. R. Tolkien's epic adventure The Lord of the Rings. Set in Middle-earth, the story tells of the Dark Lord Sauron, who is seeking the One Ring. The Ring has found its way to the young hobbit Frodo Baggins, who inherits the Ring and steps into legend. A Fellowship is formed to protect the Ringbearer and make sure that the Ring arrives at its final destination: Mt. Doom, the only place where it can be destroyed.

title: The Return of the King
author: J. R. R. Tolkien
description: The Return of the King is the third and final part of J. R. R. Tolkien's epic adventure The Lord of the Rings. Set in Middle-earth, the story tells of the Dark Lord Sauron, who is seeking the One Ring. The Ring has found its way to the young hobbit Frodo Baggins, who inherits the Ring and steps into legend. A Fellowship is formed to protect the Ringbearer and make sure that the Ring arrives at its final destination: Mt. Doom, the only place where it can be destroyed.

title: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
author: C. S. Lewis
description: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe is a children's fantasy novel by C. S. Lewis, published by Geoffrey Bles in 1950. It is the first published and best known of seven novels in The Chronicles of Narnia (1950â€“1956). It has been adapted for radio, television, the stage, and film. The story begins with the introduction of the Pevensie children, Lucy, Edmund, Susan, and Peter, who have been evacuated from London during World War II to the country home of an old professor, where they discover a wardrobe that leads to the land of Narnia, a land frozen in eternal winter by the evil White Witch, Jadis. Narnia is ruled by a line of kings and queens known as the line of Adam and Eve, and the children are enlisted to help overthrow the Witch and restore Narnia to its former glory.

title: The Da Vinci Code
author: Dan Brown
description: Seconds before Earth is demolished to make way for a galactic freeway, Arthur Dent is plucked off the planet by his friend Ford Prefect, a researcher for the revised edition of The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy who, for the last fifteen years, has been posing as an out-of-work actor.
